Questions.question: Which describes positive pressure breathing?
choices: A. It is the pulling down of air to the lungs
B. It is the swallowing or the pushing down of air to the lungs
C. It is performed by humans
D. It is the cooling down of air
Questions.answer: B. It is the swallowing or the pushing down of air to the lungs

Questions.question: Richard and Lucy tried to exhale all the air inside their lungs.  But no matter how hard they exhaled, there were air retained in their lungs.  Which describes this air?
What is the opening of the trachea where air enters the insect’s respiratory tract?
The Aorta and the carotid arteries have chemoreceptors that monitor the pH in the blood.
The following are considered as organs of the conducting portion of the human’s respiratory tract EXCEPT:
What is the use of Oxygen that you are inhaling from the environment?
choices: C. For formation of red blood cells
Questions.answer: C. For formation of red blood cells
